comments.body: Normally would say don't bother with this either but I know you just cleaned up a lot of this for consistency. I'm neutral about whether it's more readable and it's only test code.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -47,7 +47,7 @@ class MultilabelMetricsSuite extends SparkFunSuite with MLlibTestSparkContext {
     val scoreAndLabels: RDD[(Array[Double], Array[Double])] = sc.parallelize(
       Seq((Array(0.0, 1.0), Array(0.0, 2.0)),
         (Array(0.0, 2.0), Array(0.0, 1.0)),
-        (Array(), Array(0.0)),
+        (Array.empty[Double], Array(0.0)),

comments.body:
IDEA also complaints here: 
`Expression of type RDD[(Array[_ <: Double], Array[Double]) doesn't conform to expected type RDD[(Aray[Double], Array[Double])]`
I know it's OK, I make this change to eliminate the errorous warning.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -47,7 +47,7 @@ class MultilabelMetricsSuite extends SparkFunSuite with MLlibTestSparkContext {
     val scoreAndLabels: RDD[(Array[Double], Array[Double])] = sc.parallelize(
       Seq((Array(0.0, 1.0), Array(0.0, 2.0)),
         (Array(0.0, 2.0), Array(0.0, 1.0)),
-        (Array(), Array(0.0)),
+        (Array.empty[Double], Array(0.0)),
